dict.string: 1. How many chunks of information can working memory hold at one time?
The time it takes to point to a target is a constant: it takes the same amount of time to point to one target as it does to any other target.
The time it takes to point to a target is directly related to the distance to that target.
The action of clicking a button takes 200 msec.
When calculating the time it takes to point to a target, the size of the target is not important.
2. Which of the following is a description of Fitts's Law?
It is important to design around the eye's blind spot, which makes it difficult to see parts of the screen.
Be careful when using blinking text or animations because they naturally draw the user's attention.
Because the fovea encompasses only 2 degrees of visual angle, all text should be concentrated in a small area of the screen.
3. Which of the following is an implication that the characteristics of the human fovea have for the design of visual interfaces?
The cognitive processor determines that an action needs to be taken.
The motor processor completes an action based on the information.
It is deposited into working memory.
It is deposited into long-term memory.

4.According to the information processing model of human cognitive activity, which of the following happens to information from the outside world immediately after it is perceived by the perceptual processor?
pleases users by showing that we are interested in their opinion.
helps us select the best of our users.
helps us assign blame among the programmers in our team.
is the only way to discover unforeseen shortcomings of our software.
5. Feedback from users of the software systems we build is useful, and even necessary. This is because such feedback

6. Software companies often release so-called "beta" versions of software. A beta version of a program is usually given away to a selected group of users who agree to test and comment on the program before it is released to the wider market. A company that releases beta versions is thus engaging in
an affordance commonly found in drawing programs.
a programming construct used in redrawing event objects on the screen (e.g., a meeting in a scheduling program).
a built-in Java method invoked when you throw an exception for a visible icon.
the main programming construct of interactive programs.

8. When, on your computer screen, you drag the image of a folder to a different window, you are I.directly manipulating the bits of the disk file. II.manipulating an image that represents the bits of the disk file. III.generating mouse events that cause the windows interface program to redraw the image of the folder continuously, in different locations, as it appears to move.

9.Your supervisor has requested that you use a toolkit to build a fancy new user interface, and she has given you the following reasons to do so (besides enticing you with a promise of a pay raise): I.Toolkits have widgets that allow you to generate prototypes rapidly. II.If you use the same toolkits, all of the programs you write will have interfaces with a similar look and feel. III.The Internet requires that we use the prescribed open-standard UI toolkits. Which of the reasons are sound? (Again, besides the pay raise!)
10.Valid Visual Basic data types include which of the following? I.Boolean II.String III.VariantType
11. Which of the following lines contains only valid Visual Basic equation operators? I.- + * / II.\ ^ Mod III.- + * / \ ^ >>
12.In Visual Basic, what types of variables should you use when storing numbers with decimal fractions? I.variant, string, or object II.single, double, or decimal III.integer, long, or Boolean

13. At run time, you want to change the appearance of a Visual Basic control named "cmdExit" so that it appears "flat." "cmdExit" belongs to the form named "frmInput." Which of the following statements would you use?
to assign a string data type to all undeclared variables.
to require that Dim and Public statements have As data type clauses.
to initialize string variables with zero-length strings.
to flag undeclared variables as errors at compile time.
14.An Option Explicit On statement in a form's General Declarations section causes Visual Basic
15.The Code window of a Visual Basic object can be opened by selecting the object and
16.Which of the following are valid Visual Basic variable names? I.curAccounts Receivable II.3ndPlaceEntrystr III.Month_To_Datedbl
17. In Visual Basic, which of the following Val function statements will return a value equal to or less than 32? I.Val("32,543,987") II.Val(".98") III.Val("thirty-seven")
a grid used to correlate the names of local, form-level, and global variables with their properties.
the verbal equivalent of a flowchart.
a technique for planning object-oriented, event-driven applications by creating a table that correlates proposed tasks with corresponding objects and events.
a rough sketch of a planned interface.
19.Which of the Visual Basic control properties listed below holds the value you will use when setting other properties of the same control from an event handler?
20.With which of the following do developers specify the task or tasks a Visual Basic control is to perform when a user manipulates it?
21.The Visual Basic Properties window allows the developer to I.change a Visual Basic object's appearance. II.change a Visual Basic object's behavior. III.change a Visual Basic object's name.
Both advocate ignoring the users' experiences with other software.
Both draw upon the users' prior knowledge and experience.
Both recognize the tendency of users to make errors.
22.Which of the following is a similarity between the heuristics Consistency and Standards and Match Between the System and the Real World?
Match Between System and the Real World

23.While reading email, a user encounters the following message just before his email program crashes: The exception Integer division by zero (0x00000094) occurred in the application at location 0x69591070. Click OK to terminate the application.
Which of the following heuristics are violated by the behavior of this email program?
Evaluating the usability of a design in its final stages
Critiquing the designer of a system
Evaluating the usability of a design in its early stages
Advising people during a therapy session
24.Which of the following describes the most appropriate use of the technique heuristic evaluation?
Experience with the system being tested.
Similarity in experience to the people who are expected to use the final version of the system.
Availability at the time of the test (to avoid stress in the participants).
25. By which of the following criteria should we select the participants in a think-aloud usability test?

26.Which of the following are differences between the techniques of heuristic evaluation (HE) and think-aloud usability testing (TA)? I.A heuristic evaluation can be carried out on a paper prototype, whereas a TA requires a functioning prototype. II.A heuristic evaluation can be conducted by an expert analyst working alone, whereas a TA requires the participation of people who are like the application's intended users. III.TAs require the developer to 'think like a user,' whereas HEs do not.

27.Which of the following, if any, accurately describe the relationship between the evidence and explanation sections of a usability aspect report? I.Explanation is the author's interpretation of objective evidence. II.Explanation explains a solution to the problem that the evidence section describes. III.Explanation links the problem described in the evidence section to instances of the problem discovered in the past.
A usability aspect report should be no longer than one page.
Looking for patterns in usability problems is an important step in the analysis process.
It is important not to waste time on insignificant usability problems.
Usability aspect reports should be grouped by where they were found in the program.
28.In the context of writing a usability aspect report, what is meant by the statement: "Always step back and try to see the bigger picture."
Succinct description of the usability aspect
29.Which section of a usability aspect report (UAR) can serve as the UAR's "name"?

30. Which of the following are reasons why it is necessary that usability aspect reports be clear and complete? I.The usability problem may need to be described to other members of the development team who did not see the problem first-hand. II.The author of the reports needs to be able to understand them long after they are written. III.The participants in a user study need to be able to read accounts of their sessions written in lay terms.
31.Which Visual Basic control property's value is used as the identifier for the control in the code?

32.Which of the following approaches to user interface design follow the heuristic match between the system and the real world? I,Use the same vocabulary the user would use to describe things. II,Find a metaphor that describes aptly a useful portion of the computer's behavior. III,Don't clutter the screen with blinking animations.

33. Which of the following common intuitions can fruitfully be applied in user interfaces? I,If B immediately follows A in time, B is caused by A. II,If B is bigger than A, B is more important than A. III,If B is near A, B is somehow related to A.
A computer system that appears to have crashed.
A progress indicator showing how much of a file is left to download
The full Recycle Bin icon showing that the bin has files in it
The MS Windows taskbar showing the applications that are running
34.Which of the following situations violates the heuristic visibility of system status?
35.Which of the following lines contains only valid Visual Basic equation operators? I,- + * / II,\ ^ Mod III,- + * / \ ^ >>
36.The Code window of a Visual Basic object can be opened by selecting the object and
37.Which of the following are valid Visual Basic variable names? I,curAccounts Receivable II,3ndPlaceEntrystr III,Month_To_Datedbl
to flag undeclared variables as errors at compile time.
to assign a string data type to all undeclared variables.
to initialize string variables with zero-length strings.
to require that Dim and Public statements have As data type clauses.
38.An Option Explicit On statement in a form's General Declarations section causes Visual Basic
39.Which of the Visual Basic control properties listed below holds the value you will use when setting other properties of the same control from an event handler?
40. When you click the mouse on a Visual Basic control named panicButton which of the following is invoked?
with a Dim statement in the modules general procedures section.
using a special Visual Basic method (a procedure that acts on an object) to assign a shortcut character to the button.
placing an "&" (ampersand) in the button's caption immediately in front of the shortcut character.
placing an "_" (underline character) in the button's identifier in its Name property.
41.In Visual Basic, you can create a keyboard shortcut for a button by
actions that require additional information not supplied by the click
a greater variety of actions than most other controls
actions that require no additional information beyond that supplied by the click
42. Because Visual Basic buttons can only be manipulated in one way (by clicking), they are suitable to be used for
Yes, the application does not follow accepted conventions.
Consistency and standards is not applicable in this situation.
No, if the other menus are also named differently from accepted conventions.
No, if the Actions menu contains similar menu items to File menus in other applications.
43. Is the consistency and standards heuristic violated by an application with a menu called Actions instead of File?
Two or more heuristics give conflicting advice about a particular interface element.
One of your colleagues found heuristic violations that you did not.
Your client disagrees with your findings.
You think you have made a mistake in your usability aspect report.
44. Which of the following is an appropriate time to do an error analysis?

45. Which heuristic is described in the following statement? Information that is the same should appear to be the same (same words, icons, and position on the screen). Information that is different should be expressed differently.
scrolling by using the keyboard arrow keys instead of the scrollbars
increasing the speed with which the mouse moves
function or command keys which combine an entire command into a single keypress
typing (or clicking) the next input before the computer is ready to accept it
46. Which of the following is an example of a typical accelerator for frequently used operations?
There is no standard for visual cues for keyboard accelerators.
Accelerators are easy for novice users to remember.
Accelerators allow experts to learn to use the application more quickly.
A user may operate them without his hands leaving the keyboard
47.Which of the following is an advantage of keyboard accelerators?
be able to save files more often.
help people learn not to make frequent mistakes.
impair the user's natural ability to learn by doing
When it is physically set apart from other actions within the interface.
An available Cancel button never violates this heuristic.
When pressing the Cancel button undoes the previous action.
After the user has clicked an Apply button, and there are no changes that the Cancel button can undo.
49. When does the presence of an available Cancel button violate the heuristic visibility of system status?

50A reference from one UAR to another is established when I,the analyst remembers a similar previous case. II,new problems are uncovered by thinking about the trade-offs of solutions. III,a sufficient number of UARs has been written for one heuristic.
51, Which of the following features are designed to accelerate user interaction? I,History list in Web browsers. II,Bookmarks. III,List of shortcuts to recently used files

52. A Visual Basic button will hold the focus when the interface is first presented to the user, if I,its Default property is set to "true". II,its TabStop property is set to "true" and its TabIndex property is set to "0". III,its TabIndex property is set to "0".
should be carefully criticized before use.
endorses or criticizes the interface as a whole.
unambiguously endorses or criticizes the aspect of the interface to which it applies.
may occasionally both endorse and criticize one aspect of the interface.
53. A heuristic used in evaluating prototypes of a user interface:
54. Which of the following heuristics are violated by the Date/Time Control Panel Time Zone ListBox? I,Visibility of system status II,Consistency and standards III,Aesthetics and minimalist design
55. In Visual Basic, which of the following CheckBox states can a user set interactively by directly manipulating the control? I,Unchecked II,Checked III,Grayed
Checking that the window is not covered by another before displaying a menu.
Allowing users to select an item from a list rather than type the name of the item.
Not letting a novice user use a keyboard shortcut.
Checking all application variables for inconsistencies, after a change to the value of one of them is attempted by the user.
56. Which of the following is an example of error prevention in an interface?
57. Which of the following interface features does the error prevention heuristic warn us to avoid? I,Commands that are very similar II,Messages that contain double negatives III,Tabbed dialog boxes

58.Which of the following are true of Checkbox controls: I,Checkboxes are most commonly used to allow users to turn the options of larger interfaces on and off. II,Checkboxes allow users to toggle only two states interactively: checked and unchecked. III,A user cannot directly set a Checkbox to the Grayed state interactively.
59. Into which Visual Basic event handler would you insert code to record the fact that the user has selected "CrystalWare(TM) Playback" in this figure?
buttons with icons but no textual labels
hyperlinks that are not descriptive of the pages to which they link
60. Which of the following is an example of a description error as it relates to the heuristic error prevention in an interface?

61.Which of the following is a way that the Windows 98 Date/Time control panel violates the heuristic help and documentation? I,Help messages disappear when the user clicks elsewhere. II,There is no help available. III,Help messages appear in a completely separate window.
Computers are better at remembering things precisely; people are better at recognizing something that is shown to them.
People have no trouble at all remembering things exactly.
Forcing users to memorize commands is good mental practice.
It takes too long for users to recall commands from memory.
62.Which of the following is a reason that adhering to the heuristic recognition rather than recall when designing interfaces is a good idea?
Paper manuals are always available and easily searchable.
Online help can give more concrete advice than paper manuals.
Online help is always available and easily searchable.
People use paper manuals only when they have no other recourse.
63.How does online help better satisfy the heuristic help and documentation than paper manuals?
It supports the heuristic by informing users when a problem has occurred with the download.
It supports the heuristic by allowing users to choose whether or not to pay attention to the indicator.
It violates the heuristic by providing users with more information than they can deal with at one time.
It violates the heuristic by providing unhelpful information.
64.Does the presence of a status indicator as a file is downloading support or violate the heuristic help users recognize, diagnose, and recover from errors?

65.Which of the following are true of Visual Basic Textbox controls? I,They can be set to hide the characters that are entered into them, allowing them to be for password entry. II,They can be set to display either a single line of text or multiple lines. III,They support keyboard editing of text but not conventional mouse select-edit functions.

66.Which of the following are true of Visual Basic scrollbar controls? I,They are not typically used for tasks where particular or exact values are needed. II,They can be manipulated in three ways: by clicking their arrow buttons, by clicking and dragging their "thumb," and by clicking anywhere on the bar between their "thumb" and arrow buttons. III,They are represented on the toolbox palette by two icons.

67.To determine if a Visual Basic control is actually in a container control and not merely "floating" over it, one can I,move the container control to see if the control in question moves with it. II,check to see if the control in question's AutoBuddy property is set to the name of the container control. III,move the control in question to see if it is limited to staying within the borders of the container control.
Make one method of completing a task obvious for novice users, and include hidden complexity for experts.
Only allow users one way to complete a task.
Include as much information relevant to an expert user as you can in an interface.
Invent several different ways to complete a task, and make each of them obvious to all users.
68.How does the usability heuristic aesthetics and minimalist design apply to the differences between novice and expert users?
The clock has an hour, minute, and second hand.
A map of the world appears on the Time Zone tab.
The date does not appear on the Time Zone tab.
The time zone is displayed on the Date & Time tab
69.How does the Date/Time control panel support the heuristic recognition rather than recall?
None of the above answers, the observation should not be interrupted

70.Which of the following is a way to tell when a participant wants to stop a usability test? I.Expressions of negative emotions, such as "I'm so stupid I'll never be able to finish this." II,Aggressive behavior towards the computer. III,Expressions of enthusiasm that seem insincere.
By telling them every detail of the project by the time they are ready to leave
71.How does a usability tester get informed consent from participants?
In a lab, a user's brain-wave patterns are recorded and analyzed while they perform a task.
The person conducting the test tells the user everything they are thinking as the user completes the task.
A user describes each step of completing a task after the task has been completed.
While being observed, a user says everything they are thinking as they perform a task.
72.Which of the following answers best describes think-aloud usability testing?
participant frustration is natural and should be always ignored.
the observer and the participant engage in an exchange about the system being tested.
the observer must form an opinion of the participant's intelligence.
the participant may ask how to do something, but the observer must not answer.

74.Your supervisor has suggested that you mention the following when introducing a think-aloud test to a participant: I,Prolonged silence will reflect negatively on the participant. II,The participant should not stop talking, even though it may seem unnatural at first. III,Once the recording begins, the observation cannot be stopped. You should decide to abide by:

75.The drivers of the United Parcel Service (UPS) carry small data entry tablets to record pick-ups and deliveries. If you were preparing a think-aloud usability test for a new version of these tablets, you would I,plan to run the test in the lab, under controlled conditions. II,plan to test outdoors, under both intense sunlight and rain. II,ask the middle managers that have to approve the devices to participate in the test.

76.When selecting the content of the tasks to be included in a think-aloud usability test, which of the following kinds of tasks should you consider? I,Tasks that will be exercised most often in the final product II,Tasks that will be exercised only in rare emergencies III,Tasks that take more than half a day of continuous interface use
is a false alarm unless confirmed by think-aloud usability tests.
will be confirmed by think-aloud testing in all cases.
will show up sooner or later in think-aloud tests with inexperienced users.
may reflect a real problem even if not corroborated by think-aloud usability tests.
77.A usability problem discovered by application of a heuristic
The information must first be translated into words before it can be vocalized.
In that case thinking-aloud involves drawing a picture and talking about it.
Thinking-aloud is not possible under those circumstances.
78How is thinking-aloud different when a user is working with information that is non-linguistic in nature?
A picture is mangled when cut from one application and pasted into another.
A sequence of user actions causes a program crash.
At times, the system becomes so slow that the user thinks something is wrong.
Icons for remote printers are too easily confused with those of an image-processing program.
79.Which of the following usability problems is most likely to be discovered by heuristic evaluation?
80.What is a critical incident? I,A complete, observable activity. II.Activity where the intention seems clear and straightforward. III,Activity with definite consequences.
The individual solutions to similar problems can be implemented by the same programmer.
The task of analyzing the results of the test can be divided among several observers.
Related problems often have common, elegant solutions.
Several mistakes made by the same user can be eliminated from consideration.
81.What is a good reason to relate Usability Aspect Reports to each other?
82.What is the name of the event that occurs when a PictureBox control is redrawn?

83.The following Visual Basic form contains a Frame that contains a Button. The Button's Name property is set to Button1. If the left mouse button is pressed when the mouse is on the location shown, what would is value of Button1.Y?

84.Consider the following nesting of Visual Basic objects Form Frame1 Button11 Frame2 Button21
If the x-coordinate of the center of Button21 is located at x in the Button21 coordinate system, what would be the value of that x-coordinate in terms of the Frame1 coordinate system?

85.The following Visual Basic form contains a Frame that contains a Button. The Button's Name property is set to Button1. If the left mouse button is pressed when the mouse is on the location shown, what would is value of Button1.X?
86.For the Visual Basic Graphics Class, drawing operations are implemented as
87.Which corner is designated with coordinates (0,0) in Visual Basic code?
88.Which of the following method calls would force the PictureBox pb to immediately redraw itself?
relative to its immediate container and never relative to the overall form
relative to the screen upon which it will display
relative to its immediate container and possibly relative to the overall form
89.The X and Y properties of a Visual Basic control are always expressed
90.What Visual Basic component raises an event at regular intervals and can be useful in creating animated graphics?
information about the state of the object is used to determine how the input should be interpreted
the objects searches for an appropriate handler
the object is redrawn to provide feedback, if necessary
the object reacts to the input
91.When an event on a custom interactive object is handled, which of the following is the step that follows picking?
largest x- and largest y-coordinate contained in it
92.In Visual Basic, the extent of a part is synonymous with its
choosing the order in which to redraw "damaged" objects
choosing the object "on top" when layers exist
choosing the object upon which an event occurred
choosing the part of an object upon which an event occurred
the largest part is tested first
the part drawn last is tested first
the smallest part is tested first
the part drawn first is tested first
94.When an event occurs at a position shared by overlapping parts,
95How many comparisons are required to perform a bounding box test?
allows an unlimited number of undos
permits only a limited number of undos
is implemented in an object-oriented language
96.Undo can be a potentially dangerous operation unless it
choosing to log out of the system
changing option settings in a program
97.Which of the following operations is considered irreversible by most systems?
the user may often change her mind, resulting in several duplicate undos
one user action may result in the changing of many program values
several user actions typically are required to change one program value
program values that are changed are typically large
98.Typically, an undo subsystem cannot make use of singular adds and restores because
provide the user with access to state variables thus giving him the ability to restore an old state
at timed intervals, save the state of a program
save variables that have changed and provide a way to restore the old values
save variables that haven't changed so as to map commonalities in program state
99.Which of the following statements provides the best description of undo from the implementation point-of-view?
100.Program states saved by an undo subsystem would most appropriately be stored in which data structure?

101.A reference from one UAR to another is established when I,the analyst remembers a similar previous case. II,new problems are uncovered by thinking about the trade-offs of solutions. III,a sufficient number of UARs has been written for one heuristic.
